alphabet1.description: Felix recognizes F, S and O really well.  We're working on many others.

alphabet2.description: We're working on the 'at' words and this sentence, but I can't say Felix has it yet.

ice_skating.description: Dean and Felix and a bunch of ex-Snuggery kids went to Berkeley's ice rink.   Felix was pretty much hopeless on the ice, but loved the vending machine where you moved a claw to pick up your piece of candy.
ice_skating.title: Ice Skating

joyces.description: Dean and Felix had a sleepover at the Joyce's for New Year's Eve.   Lucie and he-who-wakes-at-5:30-or-6 stayed at home and went to bed at a more reasonable hour.
joyces.title: Joyces

milo2.description: When Milo's not busy being Super Active Boy, he cuddles up with Lula the cat.   For the last few weeks, he always requests Lula at bedtime.

wash2.description: It even gets Felix interested in washing dishes.

description:
Happy New Year!

Felix loves a good rule. He's incrasingly looking out for them, even when they aren't to his benefit. Recent examples:

  • When given a time out next to a bookshelf: You can't give me a time out here... this place has books!
  • When asking for a banana: You can't give me that. I didn't say please!

Milo still uses words sparingly, but he knows a bunch of them. Words of the week:

  • beep beep: make way! When Milo needs someone to get out of his way, he'll do the most adorably goofy "beep beep!"
  • o-hee: coffee. He likes to talk about Dean's coffee at cafes and at home. He'll even pretend to make coffee in his play kitchen.
  • a-teau: gateau (cake)
  • bubble: Mostly used to talk about his book about bubbles.
  • wah wah wah: cry. Refers to The Wheels on the Bus song and book.
  • rory: Frosty (the Snowman). A favorite book.
  • mimi: Mimi. Mimi the mouse, a favorite book.
Check out the story that Felix and Dean wrote.
title: January 1
